name: João Filgueiras Lima
content:
João Filgueiras Lima (June 19, 1931 – May 21, 2014)  was a Brazilian architect, also known as Lelé.  He won the Grand Prize of the Biennale of Architecture an Engineering in Madrid to Mexico.[1]
 
 This article about a Brazilian architect is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.

Brazilian architect
João Filgueiras LimaBornJune 19, 1931Rio de JaneiroDiedMay 21, 2014NationalityBrazilianOccupationArchitectAwardsGrand Prize of the Biennale of Architecture an Engineering in Madrid to Mexico.
João Filgueiras Lima (June 19, 1931 – May 21, 2014)  was a Brazilian architect, also known as Lelé.  He won the Grand Prize of the Biennale of Architecture an Engineering in Madrid to Mexico.[1]

^ International Architecture Yearbook, Volume 7. Images Publishing. 2001. p. 14. ISBN 978-1-86470-103-6.
